snippet: The Toronto International Film Festival has closed its first four days to any movie that previously played in North America, a move that some think will threaten smaller films’ Oscar chances.
abstract: Toronto International Film Festival closes the first four days of its 11-day event to any film that has previously played in North America; move raises concerns for makers of independent movies, who in past years debut films first at competing Telluride Film Festival in Colorado.
lead_paragraph: The Toronto International Film Festival has closed its first four days to any movie that previously played in North America, a move that some think will threaten smaller films’ Oscar chances.

headline.main: In the Race for Oscars, Toronto Puts Up a Hurdle
headline.print_headline: In the Race for Oscars, Toronto Puts Up a Hurdle
